object.name: Device.Time.
object.description:
This object contains global parameters relating to the NTP time clients and or servers that are active in the device. This object can be used to model SNTP and NTP clients and servers.
Both NTP and SNTP have identical packet formats and use the same mathematical operations to calculate client time, clock offset, and roundtrip delay. From the perspective of an NTP or SNTP server, there is no difference between NTP and SNTP clients, and from the perspective of an NTP or SNTP client, there is no difference between NTP and SNTP servers. SNTP servers are stateless like NTP servers in non-symmetric modes and can handle numerous clients, but SNTP clients usually operate with only one server at a time, unlike most NTP clients.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables all the time clients and servers.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Reflects the global time synchronisation status of the CPE. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates that the CPE's time client services are disabled.
Indicates that the CPE's absolute time has not yet been set by any of the configured time clients.
Indicates that the CPE has acquired accurate absolute time; its current time is accurate. One or more time client was able to configure the time of the CPE.
{{deprecated|2.16|due to the introduction of {{object|Client}}}}
MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition. None of the configured Time clients were able to synchronize the time.

parameter.description:
First NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.
{{deprecated|2.16|due to the introduction of {{object|Client}}}}

parameter.description: The current date and time in the CPE's local time zone.

parameter.name: LocalTimeZone
parameter.description:
The local time zone definition, encoded according to IEEE 1003.1 (POSIX). The following is an example value:
: EST+5 EDT,M4.1.0/2,M10.5.0/2

object.name: Device.Time.Client.{i}.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to an time client instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the time client.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of Time support for this client. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates that the time client service is being disabled
Indicates that the time client absolute time has not yet been set.
Indicates that the time client has acquired accurate absolute time; its current time is accurate.
MAY be used by the time client to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: Specifies in which mode the NTP client must be run. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Support for the NTP client in unicast mode.
Support for the NTP client in broadcast mode.
Support for the NTP client in multicast mode.
Support for the NTP client in manycast mode.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Specify the port used to send NTP packets. {{bibref|RFC5905|Section 7.2}}

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Specifies the supported NTP version. Possible versions are 1-4.

parameter.name: Servers
parameter.description: Points to a CSV list of NTP servers or pools. A NTP server can either be specified as an IP address or a host name. It is expected that the NTP client resolves multiple addresses which can change over time when {{param|ResolveAddresses}} is enabled.

parameter.name: ResolveAddresses
parameter.description: When this option is enabled the NTP client must resolve the multiple addresses associated with the host name(s) that are specified in the {{param|Servers}} field.

parameter.name: ResolveMaxAddresses
parameter.description: When {{param|ResolveAddresses}} is enabled, This parameter specifies the maxium number of IP addresses that the NTP client can resolve. 0 means that all addresses must be resolved.

parameter.name: Peer
parameter.description: Use symmetric active association mode. This device may provide synchronization to the configured NTP server.

parameter.name: MinPoll
MaxPoll
IBurst
parameter.description: If the {{param}} parameter is enabled, and this is the first packet sent when the server has been unreachable, the client sends a burst. This is useful to quickly reduce the synchronization distance below the distance threshold and synchronize the clock. {{bibref|RFC5905}}.

parameter.name: Burst
parameter.description: If the {{param}} parameter is enabled and the server is reachable and a valid source of synchronization is available, the client sends a burst of BCOUNT (8) packets at each poll interval. The interval between packets in the burst is two seconds. This is useful to accurately measure jitter with long poll intervals. {{bibref|RFC5905}}.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: The IP Interface associated with the ''Client'' entry.

parameter.name: BindType
parameter.description: Specifies how the client sockets are bound. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The client sockets are bound to a local IP address.
The client sockets are bound to a network device. This can be useful when the local address is dynamic.

object.name: Device.Time.Client.{i}.Authentication.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to enabling security for the time client.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables authentication of the time client.

parameter.name: Certificate
parameter.description: Points to the certificate that must be used by the NTS-KE client.

parameter.name: NTSPort
parameter.description: On this port the NTS Key Establishment protocol is being provided.

object.name: Device.Time.Client.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object specifies the statistic parameters for the time client. {{bibref|RFC9249|Chapter 8 NTP Yang Module}}

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that have been successfully sent from the NTP client to the NTP server.

parameter.name: PacketsSentFailed
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that were not successfully sent to the NTP server.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that have been successfully received by the NTP client from the NTP server.

parameter.name: PacketsDropped
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that were received by the NTP client but were not successfully processed or handled due to errors or other issues.

object.name: Device.Time.Server.{i}.Authentication.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to enabling security for the NTP Server.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables authentication of the NTP server.

parameter.name: Certificate
parameter.description: Points to the certificate that must be used by the NTS-KE client.

parameter.name: NTSNTPServer
parameter.description: Points to a CSV list of NTP servers. A NTP server can either be specified as an IP address or a host name. When used the NTS-KE server will tell the remote NTS-KE client the NTP hostname or address of the NTP server(s) that should be used. This allows to seperate the NTP server and NTS-KE server implementation.

object.name: Device.Time.Server.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object specifies the statistic parameters for the NTP server. {{bibref|RFC9249|Chapter 8 NTP Yang Module}}

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that have been successfully sent from the NTP server to the NTP client.

parameter.name: PacketsSentFailed
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that were not successfully sent to the NTP client.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that have been successfully received by the NTP server from a NTP client.

parameter.name: PacketsDropped
parameter.description: Specifies the number of packets that were received by the NTP server but were not successfully processed or handled due to errors or other issues.
